translation.text:
Buses are replacing trains between Hornsby and Berowra due to a tree blocking the track at Mount Kuring-gai. Please allow additional travel time. Due to external power supply issues affecting station lighting, services are also not stopping at Burwood station until further notice. Please listen to announcements, check indicator boards, and monitor Transport apps for updates. 

Buses also replace trains between Hornsby and Morisset, change at Hornsby for a replacement bus service to Morisset.
Central Coast & Newcastle Line - Partial Closure

Limited buses continue to replace trains between Morisset and Hornsby due to severe weather conditions affecting signalling and track equipment at Wyong and Hawkesbury River. Major delays are being experienced; customers are advised to delay their journey or make alternative travel arrangements if possible. 

A shuttle train service is in operation between Morisset & Newcastle Interchange in both directions, and between Hornsby and Central in both directions. Please listen to announcements, check indicator boards, and monitor Transport apps for updates.

Trains have been suspended between Thirroul and Waterfall due to heavy rain activating safety monitors and slip detectors at Helensburgh. Buses will replace services in the affected area. Train stopping patterns may change at short notice. We advise customers to listen for announcements and check indicators before boarding trains. Also, trains have been suspended between Port Kembla North and Port Kembla due to urgent signal equipment repairs at Port Kembla.
Eastern Suburbs & Illawarra Line, South Coast Line - Major delays

due to urgent signal equipment repairs at Martin Place and a tree branch on the tracks at Como earlier. Trains have been suspended between Port Kembla Nth and Port Kembla due to urgent signal equipment repairs at Port Kembla. Train stopping patterns may change at short notice. We advise customers to listen for announcements and check indicators before boarding trains.

Trains have been suspended between Kingsrove and Turrella in both directions due to heavy rainfall causing flooding at Bardwell Park.
- Limited number of buses will operate between Turrella and Kingsgrove.
- Shuttle trains continue to operate between the City and Turrella via Airport stations.
- Shuttle trains are operating between Kingsgrove and Campbelltown. Limited number of buses will operate between Turrella and Kingsgrove.
- We recommend customers delay their journey or make alternative arrangements. Train stopping patterns may change at short notice. Please listen for announcements and check indicators before boarding trains.

Trains have been suspended between Campbelltown and Goulburn in both directions due to severe weather conditions. Presently, a limited number of buses are operating in the affected area. We recommend customers delay their journey or make alternative arrangements.

Services are running to a reduced frequency due to severe weather conditions affecting network infrastructure at various locations; Please allow additional travel time. Richmond Line services are stopping all stations between Richmond and Liverpool via Merrylands in both directions. We are working hard to provide frequent services and as a result train stopping patterns and departure platforms may change at short notice. Please listen to announcements, check indicator boards, and monitor Transport apps for updates.

Owing to the severe weather conditions being experienced around the network some services are delayed. The frequency of services may be reduced and stopping patterns may change at short notice.
T1 Western Line services will be running to an altered stopping pattern due to urgent infrastructure repairs caused by weather conditions at Central:
- T1 Western Line services from Emu Plains/ Penrith will stop as scheduled to Strathfield and terminate. Please Change at Strathfield for a train to Central, however, there will be a reduced service frequency between Strathfield and Central. 
- T1 Western Line services to Emu Plains/ Penrith will now commence from Redfern. Customers are advised  to change at Redfern or Strathfield to complete their journey.
- Richmond trains are now operating between Richmond and Liverpool, stopping all stations due to flooding at Olympic Park. Customers wishing to travel to the City may need to change at Parramatta and Strathfield to complete their journey.

Services are currently suspended between Lidcombe and Olympic Park due to flooding at Olympic Park. Customers are advised to utilise local buses or to make their own travel arrangements.
Local Bus route 525 operates a shuttle between Burwood, Strathfield, Olympic Park and Parramatta stations.

Services have now resumed due to flooding at Marrickville earlier. Train stopping patterns may change at short notice. We advise customers to listen for announcements and check indicators before boarding trains.

Due to a landslide at Leura, a tree caught in the overhead wiring at Blackheath and earlier infrastructure damage caused by bushfires buses are replacing trains between Lawson, Lithgow and Bathurst . All train services will now terminate and commence from Lawson. Delays are being experienced in the area so please allow plenty of additional travel time, listen to announcements, check station indicators and real time apps for any changes as stopping patterns and platforms may change at short notice.

With ongoing rainfall being experienced and the potential of flash flooding, please remember to take extra care when boarding and alighting from trains, and when travelling through station concourses or platforms. Weather conditions may impact train services in some areas; Before you travel please check Transport apps or visit transportnsw.info for up-to-date train running information.
Severe Wet Weather Conditions - Rail Network

Severe weather conditions are affecting rail infrastructure across the Sydney Trains and NSW TrainLink networks. Multiple instances of trees in overhead wiring and blocking tracks, flooding, external power supply issues and signal equipment repairs are causing delays across most train lines. Customers are advised to avoid any non-essential travel and if you must travel, please allow plenty of additional travel time. Be weather wise and avoid rushing and stepping in puddles to prevent slips, trips and falls.

A-League: Newcastle Jets v Central Coast Mariners - McDonald Jones Stadium, Broadmeadow
16:00 to 18:00
- The closest station to McDonald Jones Stadium is Broadmeadow on the Central Coast & Newcastle Line. The stadium is approximately a 15-20 minute (1.5km) walk from the station.


Details: https://transportnsw.info/events/2020/02

Lawson, Woodford, Linden, Faulconbridge, Valley Heights, Warrimoo, Lapstone due to a landslide at Leura, a tree caught in the overhead wiring at Blackheath and earlier infrastructure damage caused by bushfires. Buses are replacing trains between Lawson, Lithgow and Bathurst.

Lawson due to a landslide at Leura, a tree caught in the overhead wiring at Blackheath and earlier infrastructure damage caused by bushfires. Buses are replacing trains between Lawson, Lithgow and Bathurst.
Hurstville due to urgent signal equipment repairs at Martin Place.

Lawson due to a landslide at Leura, a tree caught in the overhead wiring at Blackheath and earlier infrastructure damage caused by bushfires. Buses are replacing trains between Lawson, Lithgow and Bathurst.
Hurstville Due to urgent signal equipment repairs caused by severe weather conditions.
Martin Place Due to urgent signal equipment repairs caused by severe weather conditions at repairs at Wollongong.
due to a landslide at Leura, a tree caught in the overhead wiring at Blackheath and earlier infrastructure damage caused by bushfires. Buses are replacing trains between Lawson, Lithgow and Bathurst.
due to severe weather conditions affecting signalling and track equipment at Wyong, Hawkesbury River, and Berowra. Major delays are being experienced; please delay all non-essential travel.
Due to urgent signal equipment repairs caused by severe weather conditions.

Southern Highlands Line - No Service between Campbelltown and Goulburn due to severe weather conditions. Presently, numerous bus companies have been contacted, however due to their own commitments are unable to supply buses. We recommend customers delay their journey or make alternative arrangements.
This service will have the first 4 carriages locked due to an operational issue.
The lift between the station concourse, gallery level and Martin Place is temporarily out of service. If you require assistance, please call staff at Martin Place Station on 9379 4858.
The lift between George Street and the concourse is temporarily out of service. If you require assistance, please ask staff or phone 9379 4110.

Customers, due to Wynyard station upgrade the lifts from George Street to Concourse Level will be closed from Saturday 08 February until July 2020.   During these works, Customers will be able use alternate lifts from Wynyard Station to Carrington Street and York Street accessed via Margaret Street.  For further information or assistance, Please follow station staff instructions, station signage or call Wynyard Station on 9224 2959.

The lift between the concourse and platform 2 is temporarily out of service. Customers travelling from the city who require lift access should alight at International Airport station and catch a service from platform 1 back to Domestic Airport station. You can also call 8337 8450 for assistance.

Metro services are terminating and commencing from North Ryde station due to flooding between North Ryde and Chatswood. Replacement buses are in operation, however customers wishing to change for a Metro service should do so at Epping instead of Chatswood.
Station Update - Cowan, Croydon, Glenbrook and more

Burwood, Glenbrook, Croydon, Canley Vale, Cowan, Holsworthy & Strathfield Stations - External power supply issues are affecting platform screens, Opal card readers and station lighting. For Opal information or fare adjustments, please visit transportnsw.info/opal.  Burwood - No services are stopping at platforms 1 & 2  Croydon - No services are stopping at Croydon until further notice. Buses are being arranged with no forecast at this stage.

The public toilets at Beverly Hills station are currently unavailable while major repairs take place. Temporary toilets have been provided and are located outside the station on Tooronga Terrace. These facilities can be accessed during staffed hours. We apologise for any inconvenience.

Guildford Station. Due to severe weather conditions - the Station subway is flooded and not accessible from Military Road (Platform 1) to Railway Terrace (Platform 2).  Please see station staff for assistance.

Due to station maintenance works, the pedestrian ramp between Richmond Platform 2 and the concourse is closed. If you are unable to use the stairs, a shuttle bus to and from East Richmond station will be available.   For further assistance, please see station staff or call 9851 7248.

The public toilets at St James Station are closed while major works are taking place. Public toilets are located at the Elizabeth Street entrance to the right and in Hyde Park through the Macquarie Street tunnel up the stairs to the right. We apologise for any inconvenience.

New Metro Platforms are being constructed on platforms 1 & 2 at Sydenham Station. T3 Bankstown Line services to the City operate from platform 3 & T3 Bankstown Line services to Lidcombe and Liverpool operate from platform 4. Platform 4, 5 & 6 upgrade works - A new Metro concourse is also being constructed at the Northern end of the station. While the concourse is being installed, please board and alight from the first 5 carriages of the train on platforms 4 & 6 and the last 6 carriages of the train on platform 5. If you need help, please see staff at the station. For more information on these upgrades, please see sydneymetro.info

Station Upgrade - Customers, due to Wynyard station upgrade the lifts from the concourse level to George Street will be closed from Saturday 8th February until July 2020. Customers will be able use alternate lifts from Wynyard Station to Carrington Street and York Street accessed via Margaret Street.  For further information or assistance, Please follow station staff instructions, station signage or call Wynyard Station on 9224 2959.
